1.20.18  11:33 am   Hi bill, why don't you ever use smiley faces (emoticones?) when answering questions?

     (I've been here for a long time and haven't seen you use it) I actually really like that you don't, just wondering if it's part of your writing ethics, if there's a specific reason. Thanks for taking the time to answer my questions.

1.20.18  11:32 am   Why do you think you get so much flack when you answer questions about music theory? I think maybe some people are very anti-theory because they see it as being "The Rulebook" or "The Definitive Guide of How to Make Music" and you MUST follow these strict rules to be a 'serious musician'?.. But really, there are no 'rules' in theory...

      Isnt theory just giving names to things that already exist?

     Like just saying that this combination of notes is called this chord or that scale or whatever?
